definition: to warn repeatedly/to urge/to exhort again and again
to sting or bite (of mosquito, bee etc)/to say repeatedly/to urge insistently/to ask repeatedly/to stick to a point/(onom.) tinkling or jingling sound

sentences.english: One day I was going to my auntie's home, mom told me to bring an umbrella in case it mined.
sentences.chinese: 一天我去姑姑家，媽媽叮囑我帶把傘以防下雨。

sentences.english: Lin Yuhui once told Cheng Bijian to beware of high gold.
sentences.chinese: 林語慧曾經叮囑高金榜提防程碧劍。

sentences.english: Our parents used to remind us to put our toys away when we were done with them.
sentences.chinese: 小時候，父母總是叮囑我們玩了玩具之後要收好。

sentences.english: Gerald helped his wife into the carriage and gave orders to the coachman to drive carefully.
sentences.chinese: 傑拉爾德把妻子扶進馬車，叮囑車伕小心駕駛。

sentences.english: Jean Valjean's injunction, and the name of Madame Thenardier, had chilled her blood.
sentences.chinese: 冉阿讓的叮囑和德納第這名字早已使她麻木了。

sentences.english: At the same time told I dare stone must be a good person, the destruction of all the bad.
sentences.chinese: 同時叮囑石敢當一定要好好做人，殺盡天下壞人。

sentences.english: The doctor told him to bathe his eyes with a very dilute solution of boric acid.
sentences.chinese: 醫生叮囑他用稀釋的硼酸溶液洗他的眼睛。

sentences.english: East plant told mother no application susceptibility show.
sentences.chinese: 東株叮囑母親不準應用敏秀。

sentences.english: He had been warned not to tell anyone about it.
sentences.chinese: 曾經叮囑他不要和任何人講這事。

sentences.english: I remembered having asked you to prepare two such dresses before our leaving, didn't I?
sentences.chinese: 我記得出國前叮囑過你準備兩套這樣的禮服。

sentences.english: God tells me not to faint.
When the researcher briefly left the room, the children were told not to look.
sentences.chinese: 研究人員叮囑小孩不要向後面看，才離開房間。

sentences.english: Bobridge told Lin Lei to allow the company to maintain growth performance, more to deal with tianlong.
sentences.chinese: 駿升叮囑林磊讓公司維持業績增長，更加要對付天龍。

sentences.english: Immediately told stone I dare to survey murderesss whereabouts.
sentences.chinese: 當即叮囑石敢當好好調查女殺手的去向。

sentences.english: Then enjoining him to keep it strictly confidential, he told him the whole story.
sentences.chinese: 叮囑他嚴守祕密，然後把這事講出來。

sentences.english: The doctor ordered you to stay in bed.
sentences.chinese: 醫生叮囑你要臥牀休息。

definition: to warn/to urge/to exhort/to give instructions carefully and insistently
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
from time to time/now and then/occasionally/frequently
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
